title: Glossary
content:
Defines all the terms used in this document

A definition of set of characters.

It can be simple list of characters (for exampleaeiouy)
				or combined with use ofpredefined character classes. These classes can be used anywhere in the
				definition, if the characters '[',':' and ']' (square brackets
				and colon) need to be defined for a particular group, they cannot be written in a "[:" or ":]"
				form, they must be escaped and cannot follow each other.

An enumeration of characters that belong in a continuous range can be simplified by the
				'-' (minus) character to define an interval of characters. For example the string "abcdef"
				can be simplified witha-finterval. If the character '-' (minus)
				is needed in the character group and not used by the interval definition, it
				must be at the start or at the end of thecharactersproperty. For example "a-r-"
				defines a character group of any lowercase characters between 'a' and 'r' and '-'.

Predefined character classes can also be used in the following forms:[:<predefined character class>:-<list of omissions>:]. Where<predefined character class>is one of the predefined character classes and<list of omissions>might contain
				enumeration of characters (for example[:lowercase:-abc:]means all lowercase characters except 'a', 'b' and 'c'), 
				interval(s) of characters (for example[:letter:-a-dX-Z:]means all letters except intervals 'a-d' and 'X-Z') or 
				another predefined character class (for example[:all:-digit:]means all non-digits).

It is also possible to define the complement of a set. The complement of the set might again be
				enumeration of characters (for example[:-abc:]means all except characters 'a', 'b' and 'c'), 
				interval(s) of characters (for example[:-a-dX-Z:]means all except intervals 'a-d' and 'X-Z') or 
				another predefined character class (for example[:-digit:]means all non-digits).
